    • Method Detail

      • shellSort

        private void shellSort(int leftBound,
             int rightBound)
        Shell Sort Implementation With Fibonacci'sNumbers: 

         Worst Case: Depends On Input
 Average Case: Depends On Input
 Best Case: O(n)

        The Algorithm Works By Dividing The Array In h List, And Calling Insertion Sort On Them. It Then Proceeds To Lower The h Value And Recalling Insertion Sort On The New Created Lists, Until h Reaches 1. In This Implementation, The h Values Are Calculated By Using Fibonacci's Numbers, With The First h Value As The Bigger Fibonacci's Number Less Than The Array's Length.

        Parameters:
        leftBound - Left Limit For The Range Of Array's Values To Sort
        rightBound - Right Limit For The Range Of Array's Values To Sort

      • getArraySort

        public T[] getArraySort()
        Return The Sorted Array
        Returns:
        The Array
